initial_formation: Short mixed lines in a line formation, belt hold (L hand over R). If no belt, hands joined down at sides in a low 'V'. Face R of center (toward LOD/CCW travel). Weight on L foot.
coordinate_convention: Relative directions: 'R of center' = facing along line of dance (LOD, counterclockwise); 'face center' = turn to face inward toward center of circle/line curvature. Steps described for an individual dancer, mirrored by footwork reversals when stated. Counts use 9/16 grouped as 1-2-3-A (Quick-Quick-Quick-Slow).

steps.part: Figure I: Travelling and Rocking Step
steps.direction: Facing R of center; moving in LOD (CCW)
steps.notes: ct1: Cukce on L. ct2: step R. ct3: Cukce on R. ctA: step L.

steps.part: Figure I: Travelling and Rocking Step
steps.direction: Begin facing R of center; turn to face center during ct2
steps.notes: ct1: Cukce on L. ct2: step R to R side while turning to face center. ct3: step L behind R. ctA: step R to R side.

steps.part: Figure I: Travelling and Rocking Step
steps.notes: ct1: low hop on R, bring L around in front of R (L knee bent, foot low). ct2: step L in front of R. ct3: low step back on R. ctA: low step forward on L. (cts 3-A feel like 'rock-rock').

steps.part: Figure I: Travelling and Rocking Step
steps.notes: Repeat meas 3 with opposite footwork (swap L/R).

steps.part: Figure I: Travelling and Rocking Step
steps.direction: Reverse travel direction and reverse footwork relative to meas 1-4
steps.notes: Repeat meas 1-4 but reverse footwork and direction (i.e., travel opposite LOD and mirror steps).

steps.action_type: forward-ball step + back-full step with knee lifts (in place)
steps.notes: ct1: step on ball of R in front of L. ct2: step back onto full L, pick up R knee sharply. ct3: step on ball of R in front of L. ctA: step back onto full L, lift R foot to R side; knees close together.
ct1: close R to L with sharp click; weight equal on both. ct2: fall onto L, raise R foot to R side (knees close). ct3: repeat ct1. ctA: repeat ct2.
On final count of final repetition, raise R knee in front to prepare for next figure.

steps.part: Figure III: Travelling Step and Jumps
steps.direction: Facing R of center; moving in LOD (CCW)
steps.notes: ct1: Cukce on L. ct2: step R. ct3: Cukce on R. ctA: step L.

steps.part: Figure III: Travelling Step and Jumps
steps.direction: Turn to face center during meas 2
steps.notes: ct1: step R to R. ct2: step L behind R. ct3: step R in place, raise L foot to L side (knees close). ctA: close L to R with sharp click.

steps.part: Figure III: Travelling Step and Jumps
steps.notes: ct1: jump, land feet apart to sides. ct2: jump, bring feet together with a click. ct3: repeat ct1. ctA: repeat ct2.

steps.part: Figure III: Travelling Step and Jumps
steps.notes: ct1: hop on L in place, lift R knee. ct2: step R to R. ct3: step L in front of R. ctA: step back on R in place.

steps.part: Figure III: Travelling Step and Jumps
steps.direction: Reverse travel direction and reverse footwork relative to meas 1-4
steps.notes: Repeat meas 1-4, reversing footwork and direction.

steps.action_type: ball steps with forward bend + leg lifts (in place)
steps.notes: ct1: step on ball of R in front of L; equal weight on balls of both. ct2: bend forward from waist; take full weight on R, bend R knee; bring L foot up sharply behind R (L knee bent, turned out). ct3: step back on ball of L; equal weight on balls as torso straightens. ctA: take full weight on L; raise R leg sharply in front (knee bent).
ct1: small leap on R to R. ct2: stamp L slightly forward, no weight. ct3: small leap on L beside R. ctA: stamp R slightly forward, no weight.
Maintain compact, sharp styling; knees slightly bent; 'heavy' quality.

inferred_relations.notes: Belt hold with L hand over R; if no belt, hands joined low in 'V'.
All dancers execute counts in unison in 9/16 grouped 1-2-3-A (Quick-Quick-Quick-Slow).
Figures alternate between facing R of center (travel) and facing center (in-place/turning sequences).
When stated, travel is along LOD (CCW); later repetitions reverse direction as specified.
